title: [REQ] Allow mustache templates to support matrix parameters
description:
Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

In a customer project we need to generate server and client side code for APIs containing matrix parameters. Although the parameter style "matrix" is available as a variable in mustache, there is no corresponding boolean variable to check for this value (in contrast to isDeepObject for example). Since there is no logic allowed in templates, it is not possible to define a custom template in order to support matrix parameters.

Describe the solution you'd like

It would be very helpful if the mustache parameter context would contain a boolean value to check if a certain parameter is a path variable of style "matrix", much like it is already possible to check for style "deepObject". The changes required to add this value would be very small, I already created a suitable PR.

Describe alternatives you've considered

A rather dirty workaround would be to generate java code that does this comparsion during runtime (resulting in code like if ("matrix".equals("matrix"))), but this is pretty ugly and does not work generating annotations in server code.
